Package com.behreajj.camzup.friendly

Class TextShape

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.friendly.TextShape
public abstract class TextShape extends Object
Converts AWT font glyphs to curves or meshes.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final char
    LINE_HEIGHT_SAMPLE_A
    One of two characters sampled from a font to establish an appropriate line height.
    static final char
    LINE_HEIGHT_SAMPLE_B
    One of two characters sampled from a font to establish an appropriate line height.
    static final char
    SPACE_WIDTH_SAMPLE
    Character used to establish the space of a width for a given font.

  • Method Details

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(processing.core.PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, boolean separate, char... characters)
      Converts a list of characters to an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses BÃ©zier curves. When the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      separate - separate curve per char
      characters - the characters
      Returns:
      the array

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(processing.core.PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, boolean separate, String str)
      Converts a string to an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses BÃ©zier curves. When the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      separate - separate curve per char
      str - the string
      Returns:
      the array

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(processing.core.PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, int... indices)
      Converts a list of glyph indices to an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses BÃ©zier curves. When the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      indices - the glyph indices
      Returns:
      the array

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(processing.awt.PGraphicsJava2D rndr, processing.core.PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, boolean separate, char... characters)
      Converts a list of characters to an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses BÃ©zier curves. When the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      rndr - the renderer
      pfont - the PFont

      detail - the level of detail
      separate - separate curve per char

      the array

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(processing.awt.PGraphicsJava2D rndr, processing.core.PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, int... indices)
      Converts a list of glyph indices to an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses BÃ©zier curves. When the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      rndr - the renderer
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      indices - the glyph indices
      Returns:
      the array

    • processGlyphCe

      protected static CurveEntity2[] processGlyphCe(FontRenderContext frc, processing.core.PFont pfont, float displayScale, float detail, boolean separate, char... characters)
      Appends curve entities to an array list based on a font rendering context, font and array of characters.
      Parameters:
      frc - the font rendering context
      pfont - the Processing font
      displayScale - the display scale
      detail - the curve detail
      separate - separate curve per char
      characters - the characters
      Returns:
      the array of glyphs

    • processGlyphCe

      protected static CurveEntity2[] processGlyphCe(FontRenderContext frc, processing.core.PFont pfont, float displayScale, float detail, int... indices)
      Appends curve entities to an array list based on a font rendering context, font and array of glyph indices
      Parameters:
      frc - the font rendering context
      pfont - the Processing font
      displayScale - the display scale
      detail - the curve detail
      indices - the glyph indices
      Returns:
      the array of glyphs

    • processGlyphCurve

      protected static void processGlyphCurve(Font font, FontRenderContext frc, float scale, float detail, char character, ArrayList<Curve2> curves)
      Converts a character to a list of curve entities. A helper function for other variants of getGlyph.

      When multiple characters are provided, the kerning between characters is better; when one character is supplied, glyphs with multiple curves (i, j, p, etc.) are easier to organize.
      Parameters:
      font - the AWT font
      frc - the font render context
      scale - the glyph scale
      detail - the detail
      character - the character
      curves - the list of curves

    • processGlyphVector

      protected static void processGlyphVector(GlyphVector gv, float scale, float detail, String namePrefix, float fontSize, ArrayList<Curve2> curves)
      Internal helper function to convert an AWT path iterator points to a curve.
      Parameters:
      gv - the glyph vector
      scale - the glyph scale
      detail - the detail
      namePrefix - the curve name prefix
      fontSize - the font size
      curves - the list of curves
      See Also:
      • GlyphVector.getOutline()
